message: unrelated: should /me be transformed into one's username? or is that too "irc-y"?
yeah, might be a fun easter egg for people who are used to irc
this search bug intrigues me, since i can't figure out any logic to it... it's not something obvious like uppercase vs. lower
Most of my searches work as expected. But when I search for "hop henge" I get no results.
I can't figure out any reason why that wouldn't be found, while other searches for similar strings work.
do you guys do search indexing or something? is it possible that fails intermittently?
/me speculates uselessly about convore internals
hmm... @ericflo is the search guy
he might know why it isn't working as expected
yeah, emoticon support is definitely going to be needed to take Convore mainstream
not to mention getting the ja market to use it (:
even weirder, now a search for "hop henge" yields the reply above
but not my prior uses
I think the /me if pretty irc-y :P
though we <3 irc, so we might use more irc-like stuff in the future
Boom ;)
One of our search indexes got out of date, I just had to do a full update
ah, seems to work now... so what happened, i'm curious?
my theory was (somewhat) correct... \m/
yay!
fwiw, I use /me all the time. In instant messages too. There should be some sort of emotive facility besides favicons and embeds. ^_^
